snippet: The District of Columbia will get another delegate, of sorts, in Congress: a statue of the abolitionist Frederick Douglass.
abstract: Congress approves a measure permitting a statue of the abolitionist Frederick Douglass to be placed in the Capitol building; approval is a symbolic achievement for the District of Columbia, which has not been permitted to install two statues in the Capitol that each state is permitted.
lead_paragraph: The District of Columbia will get another delegate, of sorts, in Congress: a statue of the abolitionist Frederick Douglass.

headline.seo: Statue of Frederick Douglass to Be Placed in Capitol
headline.main: Washington to Get Bronze Representative in Capitol
headline.print_headline: Washington to Get Bronze Representative in Capitol
